text: The 2020 ACA Africa T20 Cup Finals is a forthcoming cricket tournament due to be held in Nairobi, Kenya. The tournament was originally scheduled to be held in September 2019, but was moved to March 2020. On 9 March 2020, the tournament was postponed again due to the COVID-19 pandemic, in line with the Kenyan government's 30-day ban on international gatherings. The eight qualified teams are split into two groups, with the top two teams from each group advancing to the semi-finals. Group A consists of Ghana, Malawi, Nigeria and Uganda; while host nation Kenya are placed in group B along with Botswana, Cameroon and Mozambique. All of the matches will have full T20I status as the ICC granted T20I status to matches between all of its members from 1 January 2019. Cameroon could be playing their first matches with T20I status during this tournament, depending on when the event is rescheduled. ==Squads== Squads as announced before the event was postponed on 9 March 2020. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; margin:auto" |- !
